name: Pumpkin Pie Seeds
author: cr0ybot
summary: The pumpkins are carved, the pies are baked, but how should you toast those pumpkin seeds? My favorite variation by far are these sweet pumpkin pie-spiced seeds. I've tried the stovetop method for coating the seeds, but they were too sticky and hard for my tastes, and easy to burn too. Try this baking method instead and they'll turn out perfectly toasted and crunchy.
ingredients: 1 cup raw cleaned pumpkin seeds (preferably from a sugar pumpkin)
1 tablespoon white sugar, or to taste
directions: Place pumpkin seeds, water, and salt in a saucepan, bring to a boil, and reduce heat to medium; boil seeds for 10 minutes
Drain seeds but do not rinse
Pat seeds dry with paper towels and spread out onto a work surface or a baking sheet for 30 minutes to dry
Preheat oven to 250 degrees F (120 degrees C)
Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil
Melt butter in a large microwave-safe bowl until melted, about 1 minute
Toss seeds in the melted butter and mix in 1 tablespoon sugar, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, cloves, and cardamom; toss again to coat seeds thoroughly with spices
Spread seeds out onto the prepared baking sheet in a single layer
Bake in the preheated oven until toasted and crunchy, 45 minutes to 1 hour
Sprinkle toasted seeds with 1 tablespoon sugar or as desired; cool before serving
